newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore CPI up 2.0 pct in December, 1.4 pct 1996.
newsitem.headline: Singapore CPI up 2.0 pct in December, 1.4 pct 1996.

text.p: Singapore's consumer price index (CPI) of inflation was up 2.0 percent in December from the same month last year and up 0.2 percent over November 1996, the Department of Statistics said on Thursday.
For 1996 as a whole, the department said the CPI rose 1.4 percent over 1995, lower than the 1.7 percent increase in 1995 over 1994.
A Reuters poll of 15 economists last week forecast the CPI had risen 1.5 percent in December from a year earlier.
In November, the CPI rose 1.4 percent from a year ago and 0.2 percent from October.

Note - In December year-on-year food costs rose 3.0 percent, clothing rose 0.1 percent, housing 1.0 percent, transport and communications 2.2 percent, education and stationery 2.6 percent, health 2.6 percent and miscellaneous costs by 1.7 percent.
